Articles.Content:
actually i probably spent too much time climbing..

and the speed average was around 1250 i think.. just got that peak when descending.. in my first attempt i overshooted it and did almost 1500 peak ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)

anyway ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

yeah i did it! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

thank you sir
You're average velocity was 1254.7 m/s. How'd you get so close on the first guess?

> 
> You're average velocity was 1254.7 m/s. How'd you get so close on the first guess?

rofl, because 1250 was the surface value most of the time XD

first half got some peak at 1280..

and during descent i got the 13xx peak for a while before totally shut off the engine..

honestly i was just lucky guessing ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Hello @ all, I'm back again ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

This is not a new record, but it shows that it is possible to reach good times with the "new" rules.

No mods, no stacking, no reverted cone intake (i have never used that ....)......only a simple plane. What you see is what is in (bad english i now:blush:).

It is the craft from my testflight (38:40) at side 37 and Xannari has changed at the same time the rules (no problem you are the boss ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)). 

I have only replaced the MK16 Parachutes behind the rapiers with one radial mounted Parachute. 2-3 m/s less average speed at my favorite altitude ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) but it is nearly the same speed from my 38:42 plane.

![2015-10-19_000014wr3e.jpg](http://abload.de/img/2015-10-19_000014wr3e.jpg)

![2015-10-19_000041kp7f.jpg](http://abload.de/img/2015-10-19_000041kp7f.jpg)

![2015-10-19_00011plol4.jpg](http://abload.de/img/2015-10-19_00011plol4.jpg)

![2015-10-19_00012hppjw.jpg](http://abload.de/img/2015-10-19_00012hppjw.jpg)

Maybe I'll beat this tomorrow ![:kiss:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_kiss.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-24T22:34:42Z" title="10/24/2015 10:34  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 24, 2015</time> by HelmutK**

just a quick question due to my ignorance..

how did you calculate the average speed? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
(1200000 Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Ã¢â€¢Â¥) / (Minutes Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ 60 + Seconds)

> 
> (1200000 Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Ã¢â€¢Â¥) / (Minutes Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ 60 + Seconds)

aaah! now i see..

well actually if you add that i had an average flight height of 22000mt (spanning from 21.000 and peak of 23500 even if i remember flying at 25000 at certain moments)

it's like

622000\*2\*Ã¢â€¢Â¥/t it's more like 1182 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Hm..OK you can calculate that ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif).... but I look only at the speed i can hold (normal +/- 1 m/s)

I was going for surface velocity, but if you want a given altitude and a non-relative speed result:

((Altitude from sea level + 1200000) Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ *Ã¢â€¢Â¥*) Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ (Minutes Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ 60 + (Seconds / 21600 + 1)) / (Minutes Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ 60 + Seconds)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-23T17:18:10Z" title="10/23/2015 05:18  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 23, 2015</time> by Xannari Ferrows**

> 
> I was going for surface velocity, but if you want a given altitude and a non-relative speed result:
> ((Altitude from sea level + 1200000) Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ *Ã¢â€¢Â¥*) Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ (Minutes Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ 60 + Seconds / 21600 + 1) / (Minutes Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ 60 + Seconds)

ouch i think igot lost ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

Same flight and a nearly perfect landing:

![2015-10-20_000017vr5q.jpg](http://abload.de/img/2015-10-20_000017vr5q.jpg)

![2015-10-20_00004tfqbb.jpg](http://abload.de/img/2015-10-20_00004tfqbb.jpg)

![2015-10-20_00006pdo5m.jpg](http://abload.de/img/2015-10-20_00006pdo5m.jpg)

![2015-10-20_00009zzob6.jpg](http://abload.de/img/2015-10-20_00009zzob6.jpg)

Puuuh...that's it ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

made another attempt with the cruiser mk3b.. which just have a rapier instead of a whiplash..

unfortunately i don't have the screenshot of the plane sitting on runway before start because it was supposed to be a speed test instead of a circumnavigation attempt.. but it was going so good i decided to keep going..

![EBF2566DDA047939047868655F6BEE666265F414](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/386540406527957278/EBF2566DDA047939047868655F6BEE666265F414/)

halfway.. probes @KSC for reference..

![FCB60EADAFB80F8B34449B9061680D58FE26238F](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/386540406527957772/FCB60EADAFB80F8B34449B9061680D58FE26238F/)

landed @KSC lot more speed, and 10 minutes less! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![AEFB72694DA9361D13D3C9752B25AC7E3653C132](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/386540406527967292/AEFB72694DA9361D13D3C9752B25AC7E3653C132/)

cruiser MK3b sitting right after the runway end :|

also i just noticed the cockpit has monopropellant i did not remove :|

i think i could have saved 250Kg by removing a little bit of fuel and the monoprop.. 

and fly under 25000Mt for a little bit more time, should make me move faster

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-20T21:43:59Z" title="10/20/2015 09:43  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 20, 2015</time> by cikho**
  
new pic

I may see if I can compete for the speed record. I quickly found out what others have said--managing heat is key during the ascent and descent. You gotta go as fast as you can without burning up. I was on course for a decent first try....until I evaporated at 12km altitude and 1250 m/s in a 60 degree dive toward the runway ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

nice job helmut ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

but guys! there is so much simple stuff you could do to go at least 5 m/s faster XD ! use the mk1 command pod, flip the intakes, etc.

> 
> nice job helmut ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
> but guys! there is so much simple stuff you could do to go at least 5 m/s faster XD ! use the mk1 command pod, flip the intakes, etc.

Thanks,

mk1 pod = not faster (tested)

flip intakes = no way, it's not my style

There is a challenge for you: beat my time without using exploits ![:kiss:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_kiss.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-21T22:26:51Z" title="10/21/2015 10:26  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 21, 2015</time> by HelmutK**

Helmut, what about a more sharp wing?

should decrease drag a little bit, maybe you can nibble some ten seconds ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
I thought I would try this one... but no pizza????? I don't know.... lol....
We can't have 666 replies to this thread, so here's a filler to take us out of that realm. Please good god don't make a joke out of this.

> 
> Helmut, what about a more sharp wing?
> should decrease drag a little bit, maybe you can nibble some ten seconds ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Believe me, ten seconds are worlds under 39 minutes ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif). I've tested serveral wings and these are the optimum for the whole design.

Don't trust writen values, test it.![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Top speed of the plane (old version without the radial mounted parachute) is 1742 m/s in horizontally flight, but not on the optimal altitude.

In this clean version I can reach on this altitude 1739 m/s but top airspeed does not equal to top circumnavigation time.

A good ascent, landing and right altitude makes minutes!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-21T22:32:15Z" title="10/21/2015 10:32  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 21, 2015</time> by HelmutK**

Reserved post for my second try.

EDIT : will be doing a short story instead... so see in the future for a thread in the mission reports!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-22T06:51:10Z" title="10/22/2015 06:51  AM" data-short="8 yr">October 22, 2015</time> by Joshwoo69**

helmut:

it's slightly better ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

with a test craft:

- inline cockpit: 1715 m/s

- with mk1 command pod: 1718 m/s

both were using the same ascent profile, taken at the same time, etc.

but i gotta say! draining the monoprop makes such a difference! both were taken with drained monoprop, but on the first run with the mk1 cmd pod i forgot to drain it and it peaked at 1710 m/s.

also, about beating you, would you consider flipping intakes an exploit?

what about using the mk1 cmd pod?
nice work, Helmut. You may have just inspired me to break my hiatus. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Hm...the monoprop. It is to be worth testing again. 

Flipping intakes... is it normal that a wall has less drag than a needle:confused:? Hm, let me think about...NO ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

MK1 cmd pod is a regular cockpit.

You can see what is possible with regular mounted parts. Try this, that's what I mean. 

@ExaltedDuck

Thanks,

I look forward to your next design:)
I may have to crack this nut. I was getting seriously close, but time investment is \*\*\*\*\* demanding at ~40 mins a run.

Took a crack at it.. designed the plane in a few minutes and did pretty well: 

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/rvNvx)
